channel.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

image.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition

channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2020 Turner Broadcasting System, Inc. All Rights Reserved.

item.title: Singapore's migrant workers are suffering the brunt of the coronavirus pandemic
item.description: Rubel, a 28-year-old migrant worker in Singapore, is afraid. The dormitory he and other foreign workers live in has been locked down, and nobody is allowed in or out as government officials scramble to contain the country's novel coronavirus outbreak.

item.title: Coronavirus pandemic: Latest news from around the world
Aides and allies making concerted effort to get Trump to stop doing daily briefings
Dr. Sanjay Gupta shuts down Trump's medical claim
item.description: CNN's Dr. Sanjay Gupta and Anderson Cooper talk to Dr. Leana Wen about President Trump's comments regarding the use of ultraviolet light or injections of disinfectant to try to kill coronavirus

item.title: For the first time in 16 years, the US Air Force has no heavy bombers on Guam
Navy recommends reinstating commander of USS Theodore Roosevelt
To get around stay-at-home orders, Spaniards have been walking some unusual 'pets'
item.description: The Spanish government's strict stay-at-home order allows people to leave their homes to walk their pets.

item.title: Atlanta mayor: It's like we're living in 'Twilight Zone'
item.description: Atlanta Mayor Keisha Lance Bottoms pleads for residents to stay home, despite Governor Brian Kemp lifting shelter-in-place orders and reopening some nonessential businesses.

item.title: Domestic assault may have triggered Canadian shooting rampage that left 22 dead
item.description: A domestic assault could have been the catalyst of a Nova Scotia shooting rampage that left 22 people dead, the Royal Canadian Mounted Police said Friday.

item.title: Wuhan weathered Covid-19. But can it survive what comes next?
Van Jones: I'm someone Covid-19 could easily kill. Here is what I'm doing about it
item.description: For decades, I used my social justice activism as an excuse to neglect my health. I took on cause after cause. But the whole while, I ate crappy food, rarely exercised, guzzled diet soda and rarely slept. I abused my body through stress and overwork.

item.title: Must-watch videos of the week
As Lonely Planet closes its offices, a look back at the brand's early days
item.description: The recent news that Lonely Planet Publications was shutting down its production offices in Melbourne and London almost entirely, and totally eliminating its widely admired magazine and all non-guidebook titles, didn't take me completely by surprise.

item.title: Why Donald Trump can't just move the November election
item.description: On Thursday night during a virtual fundraiser, former Vice President Joe Biden floated a very scary notion.

item.title: Trump urged to reinstate WHO funding: US 'cannot rid this insidious virus' without it
item.description: More than 1,000 organizations and individuals including charities, medical experts and healthcare companies from around the world have written to the White House arguing the Trump administration should reverse course and keep funding the World Health Organization (WHO).

item.title: NASA team develops a ventilator specifically tailored to coronavirus patients
Covid-19 amplifies prejudices against India's Muslims
item.description: Hafiz Mohammed Naseerudin says that after a police officer assaulted him for being a Muslim and blamed him for spreading the coronavirus, he was left lying on the road for almost an hour.

item.title: Europe is preparing a trillion-euro fund to rebuild its economy
item.description: EU leaders have agreed to create a fund that could raise at least 1 trillion euros ($1.1 trillion) to rebuild regional economies ravaged by the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: Bystander films tornado: 'Oh my God!'
item.description: Tornadoes caused severe damage and killed at least six in Oklahoma, Texas and Louisiana with some witnesses saying they feel "lucky to be alive." HLN's Robin Meade reports.

item.title: She lost 8 friends and family members to Covid-19. But she hasn't lost her will to help others
item.description: In the week before and after her birthday on March 25, the phone of 42-year-old Shana Jones rang nonstop with devastating news.

item.title: Trump called it a 'game changer'. Preliminary study suggests it doesn't work for very sick patients
item.description: Preliminary results of a large study of hydroxychloroquine -- the drug President Donald Trump said would be a "game changer" in the fight against coronavirus -- suggests that the drug "didn't really have much of an effect on the recovery rate," New York Gov. Andrew Cuomo said Thursday.

item.title: See how far spit droplets travel through air when we talk
item.description: The CDC recommends that all Americans wear face coverings in public. CNN's Dr. Sanjay Gupta explains why wearing them in addition to physical distancing is so important.

item.title: Prince William's reason for not watching 'Tiger King' will make you laugh
item.description: Like the rest of us, Prince William is shut in and has time to binge-watch TV, but don't expect him to be watching "Tiger King."

item.title: 'You got a friend in me!' -- Tom Hanks writes to bullied 8-year-old named Corona
item.description: Tom Hanks has a new penpal: an 8-year-old Australian boy called Corona, who says he has been bullied because of his name.

item.title: Meghan and Harry to dial into London court hearing in lawsuit against tabloids
item.description: The Duke and Duchess of Sussex will dial in to a London court hearing on Friday ahead of Meghan's lawsuit against Associated Newspapers, according to a royal source.

item.title: John Oliver takes aim at Fox News coronavirus coverage
item.description: John Oliver takes a deep dive into conservative media pushing misinformation about the coronavirus on "HBO's Last Week Tonight."

item.title: Pandemic extends Liverpool's agony after 30-year hiatus
Here's how Bruce Willis, Demi Moore and their kids are passing the time in quarantine
item.description: Buzz haircuts, fake mustaches and family paint night are how the Bruce Willis/Demi Moore clan are spending their days while in isolation.

item.title: Japanese mayor says men should grocery shop during pandemic as women 'take a longer time'
item.description: The mayor of Japan's third-largest city is facing a public backlash after he suggested men are better suited to grocery shopping during the coronavirus pandemic, because women take too long and contribute to overcrowding at supermarkets.

item.title: Richard Gere and his wife welcome baby boy
item.description: Richard Gere and his wife, Alejandra Silva, have welcomed their second son, a rep for the actor confirms to CNN.

item.title: Michelle Obama for VP in 2020?
item.description: Former First Lady Michelle Obama has repeatedly said she is not running for office, but now that Democratic nominee and former VP Joe Biden has vowed to choose a female VP, could she reconsider? Chris Cillizza explains why Michelle Obama would be a dream vice president pick, but why it's unlikely to happen.

item.title: Global stocks falter as Gilead halts trial of potential coronavirus treatment
item.description: Global stocks slumped Friday after a study into a potential coronavirus treatment was halted following inconclusive results.

item.title: Beaches are reopening. If you go, please be smart about it
item.description: Beaches are reopening at a swift rate in some of the United States' sun-soaked southern states.

item.title: Alicia Keys debuts powerful new song
item.description: Alicia Keys, a 15-time Grammy winner, debuts "Good Job" during a CNN global town hall addressing the latest developments in the Covid-19 pandemic.

item.title: Taylor Swift slams former record label for releasing new album
item.description: The longtime feud between Taylor Swift and her former record label has been reignited.

item.title: What economy class could look like after virus
item.description: It's clear flying will be different after coronavirus, and while some airlines are discussing the removal of middle seats to maintain social distancing, one airplane interiors company has come up with concepts for adapting economy class cabins.

item.title: Bars collect money from walls for laid-off employees
item.description: Bars peel dollar bills off walls and ceilings to pay laid-off workers. CNN's Jeanne Moos reports.

item.title: Hubble Space Telescope celebrates 30 years of discoveries and awe-inspiring images
item.description: The Hubble Space Telescope launched 30 years ago on Friday, forever changing the way we see the universe. The telescope's ethereal, dreamy and almost fantasy-like views of space vistas have inspired people for decades and led to some of the most important astronomical discoveries.

item.title: These otherworldly photographs warn of Iceland's disappearing rivers
item.description: The first time photographer Chris Burkard encountered the desolate beauty of Iceland, it took his breath away.

item.title: Beauty YouTuber Patrick Starrr: 'Makeup has no gender and shouldn't have one'
item.description: Growing up, I was drawn to stories of transformation. I loved America's Next Top Model and films like Cinderella and The Princess Diaries, which all center on metamorphosis through beauty.

item.title: This nutritionist is keeping schoolkids fed -- even during lockdown
item.description: The coronavirus crisis has forced schools in Kenya to close, but Wawira Njiru believes this is no reason for children to go hungry.

item.title: China reveals name of Mars mission, which will take place in 'coming months'
item.description: China's space agency revealed the name of its first Mars exploration mission on Friday, and said the mission is on track to take place "in the coming months."

item.title: Hope Solo, former USWNT goalie, announces birth of twins
item.description: Former US goalkeeper Hope Solo and husband Jerramy Stevens have welcomed twins into the world, the soccer star announced on Thursday.

item.title: Andy Murray using lockdown to watch his kids grow up
item.description: Three-time grand slam champion Andy Murray suspects that tennis will be "one of the last sports to get back to normality" and revels in the fact that the lockdown allows him to see his kids grow up.

item.title: UK to start trials of drones delivering medical supplies
Wuhan weathered Covid-19. Can it survive what's next?
item.description: • Hear from Wuhan's residents

item.title: How nursing homes are dealing with coronavirus pandemic
item.description: CNN's Sara Sidner examines how nursing homes have been dealing with the fallout of the novel coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: The authoritarian threats of coronavirus
item.description: Christiane speaks with David Rohde, author of "In Deep", and Anne Applebaum, author of the forthcoming "Twilight of Democracy", about government reactions to Covid-19.

item.title: Aides and allies making concerted effort to get Trump to stop doing daily briefings
item.description: • Trump can't stop putting his top public health officials in tough spots

item.title: How North Korea's ideology is built on song and dance
item.description: "So dear to all our hearts is our General's glorious name; our own beloved Kim Il Sung of undying fame," go the lyrics to one of North Korea's best-known songs, "Song of General Kim Il Sung," which honors the country's founding ruler and eternal president.
